#summary How to get and compile cl-osd

= Prerequisites =

  # Download and install [http://www.atmel.com/avrstudio AVR Studio 5]
  # Download and install [http://tortoisesvn.net/ TortoiseSVN]

= Getting the code =

  # Go to a folder where you want the code.
  # Press right button in folder
  # Select "SVN Checkout"
  # Enter url of cl-osd: "http://cl-osd.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/"
  # Press OK.

= Compile =

  # Open "cl-osd.avrgccproj" inside the "cl-osd" folder you created in the last step.
  # I the top you see a list with Debug, E-OSD etc. Select the board you whant to build for.
  # Press Build -> Clean cl-osd. (Only needed first time!)
  # Press Build -> Build cl-osd. (First time you might be asked to save a solutions file. Place this in the same folder as the other files)
  # In your folder cl-osd/X-OSD (where X is your target board) there should be a cl-osd.hex and a cl-osd.eep. That's the flash file and the eeprom file.
